member.name: T:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator
member.summary: Interface for components that discover the existence of SSDP devices.

remarks.para: Discovering devices includes explicit search requests as well as listening for broadcast status notifications.

member.name: E:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.DeviceAvailable
member.summary: Event raised when a device becomes available or is found by a search request.

member.name: E:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.DeviceUnavailable
member.summary: Event raised when a device explicitly notifies of shutdown or a device expires from the cache.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.NotificationFilter
member.summary: Sets or returns a string containing the filter for notifications. Notifications not matching the filter will not raise the or events.

remarks.para: Device alive/byebye notifications whose NT header does not match this filter value will still be captured and cached internally, but will not raise events about device availability. Usually used with either a device type of uuid NT header value.
Example filters follow;

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.IsSearching
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether or not a search is currently active.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.SearchAsync
member.summary: Aynchronously performs a search for all devices using the default search timeout, and returns an awaitable task that can be used to retrieve the results.
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.SearchAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a search for the specified search target (criteria) and default search timeout.
member.param:
The criteria for the search. Value can be;
Root devicesupnp:rootdevice
Specific device by UUIDuuid:<device uuid>
Device typeFully qualified device type starting with urn: i.e urn:schemas-upnp-org:Basic:1
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.SearchAsync(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs a search for the specified search target (criteria) and search timeout.
member.param:
The criteria for the search. Value can be;
Root devicesupnp:rootdevice
Specific device by UUIDuuid:<device uuid>
Device typeA device namespace and type in format of urn:<device namespace>:device:<device type>:<device version> i.e urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:Basic:1
Service typeA service namespace and type in format of urn:<service namespace>:service:<servicetype>:<service version> i.e urn:my-namespace:service:MyCustomService:1

The amount of time to wait for network responses to the search request. Longer values will likely return more devices, but increase search time. A value between 1 and 5 is recommended by the UPnP 1.1 specification. Specify TimeSpan.Zero to return only devices already in the cache.

remarks.para: By design RSSDP does not support 'publishing services' as it is intended for use with non-standard UPnP devices that don't publish UPnP style services. However, it is still possible to use RSSDP to search for devices implemetning these services if you know the service type.

member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.SearchAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs a search for all devices using the specified search timeout.
member.param: The amount of time to wait for network responses to the search request. Longer values will likely return more devices, but increase search time. A value between 1 and 5 is recommended by the UPnP 1.1 specification. Specify TimeSpan.Zero to return only devices already in the cache.
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.StartListeningForNotifications
member.summary: Starts listening for broadcast notifications of service availability.

remarks.para: When called the system will listen for 'alive' and 'byebye' notifications. This can speed up searching, as well as provide dynamic notification of new devices appearing on the network, and previously discovered devices disappearing.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.ISsdpDeviceLocator.StopListeningForNotifications
member.summary: Stops listening for broadcast notifications of service availability.

remarks.para: Does nothing if this instance is not already listening for notifications.

member.exception: Throw if the property is true.

member.name: T:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase
member.summary: Allows you to search the network for a particular device, device types, or UPnP service types. Also listenings for broadcast notifications of device availability and raises events to indicate changes in status.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The implementation to use for network communications.

member.name: E:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.DeviceAvailable
member.summary:
Raised for when
An 'alive' notification is received that a device, regardless of whether or not that device is not already in the cache or has previously raised this event.
For each item found during a device (cached or not), allowing clients to respond to found devices before the entire search is complete.
Only if the notification type matches the property. By default the filter is null, meaning all notifications raise events (regardless of ant
This event may be raised from a background thread, if interacting with UI or other objects with specific thread affinity invoking to the relevant thread is required.

member.name: E:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.DeviceUnavailable
member.summary: Raised when a notification is received that indicates a device has shutdown or otherwise become unavailable.

remarks.para: Devices *should* broadcast these types of notifications, but not all devices do and sometimes (in the event of power loss for example) it might not be possible for a device to do so. You should also implement error handling when trying to contact a device, even if RSSDP is reporting that device as available.
This event is only raised if the notification type matches the property. A null or empty string for the will be treated as no filter and raise the event for all notifications.

The property may contain either a fully complete instance, or one containing just a USN and NotificationType property. Full information is available if the device was previously discovered and cached, but only partial information if a byebye notification was received for a previously unseen or expired device.
This event may be raised from a background thread, if interacting with UI or other objects with specific thread affinity invoking to the relevant thread is required.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.SearchAsync
member.summary: Performs a search for all devices using the default search timeout.
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.SearchAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a search for the specified search target (criteria) and default search timeout.
member.param:
The criteria for the search. Value can be;
Root devicesupnp:rootdevice
Specific device by UUIDuuid:<device uuid>
Device typeFully qualified device type starting with urn: i.e urn:schemas-upnp-org:Basic:1
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.SearchAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs a search for all devices using the specified search timeout.
member.param: The amount of time to wait for network responses to the search request. Longer values will likely return more devices, but increase search time. A value between 1 and 5 seconds is recommended by the UPnP 1.1 specification, this method requires the value be greater 1 second if it is not zero. Specify TimeSpan.Zero to return only devices already in the cache.
member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDeviceLocatorBase.SearchAsync(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs a search for the specified search target (criteria) and search timeout.
member.param:
The criteria for the search. Value can be;
Root devicesupnp:rootdevice
Specific device by UUIDuuid:<device uuid>
Device typeA device namespace and type in format of urn:<device namespace>:device:<device type>:<device version> i.e urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:Basic:1
Service typeA service namespace and type in format of urn:<service namespace>:service:<servicetype>:<service version> i.e urn:my-namespace:service:MyCustomService:1

The amount of time to wait for network responses to the search request. Longer values will likely return more devices, but increase search time. A value between 1 and 5 seconds is recommended by the UPnP 1.1 specification, this method requires the value be greater 1 second if it is not zero. Specify TimeSpan.Zero to return only devices already in the cache.

remarks.para: By design RSSDP does not support 'publishing services' as it is intended for use with non-standard UPnP devices that don't publish UPnP style services. However, it is still possible to use RSSDP to search for devices implemetning these services if you know the service type.

member.returns: A task whose result is an of instances, representing all found devices.

member.summary: Sets or returns a string containing the filter for notifications. Notifications not matching the filter will not raise the or events.

remarks.para: Device alive/byebye notifications whose NT header does not match this filter value will still be captured and cached internally, but will not raise events about device availability. Usually used with either a device type of uuid NT header value.
If the value is null or empty string then, all notifications are reported.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.AddDevice(Rssdp.SsdpRootDevice)
member.summary: Adds a device (and it's children) to the list of devices being published by this server, making them discoverable to SSDP clients.

remarks.para: Adding a device causes "alive" notification messages to be sent immediately, or very soon after. Ensure your device/description service is running before adding the device object here.
Devices added here with a non-zero cache life time will also have notifications broadcast periodically.
This method ignores duplicate device adds (if the same device instance is added multiple times, the second and subsequent add calls do nothing).

member.param: The instance to add.
member.exception: Thrown if the argument is null.
Thrown if the contains property values that are not acceptable to the UPnP 1.0 specification.

member.name: M:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.RemoveDevice(Rssdp.SsdpRootDevice)
member.summary: Removes a device (and it's children) from the list of devices being published by this server, making them undiscoverable.

remarks.para: Removing a device causes "byebye" notification messages to be sent immediately, advising clients of the device/service becoming unavailable. We recommend removing the device from the published list before shutting down the actual device/service, if possible.
This method does nothing if the device was not found in the collection.

member.param: The instance to add.
member.exception: Thrown if the argument is null.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.Log
member.summary: Returns a reference to the injected instance.

remarks.para: Should never return null. If null was injected a reference to an internal null logger should be returned.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.Devices
member.summary: Returns a read only list of devices being published by this instance.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.SupportPnpRootDevice
member.summary: If true (default) treats root devices as both upnp:rootdevice and pnp:rootdevice types.

remarks.para: Enabling this option will cause devices to show up in Microsoft Windows Explorer's network screens (if discovery is enabled etc.). Windows Explorer appears to search only for pnp:rootdeivce and not upnp:rootdevice.
If false, the system will only use upnp:rootdevice for notifiation broadcasts and and search responses, which is correct according to the UPnP/SSDP spec.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.StandardsMode
member.summary: Sets or returns a value from the controlling how strictly the publisher obeys the SSDP standard.

remarks.para: Using relaxed mode will process search requests even if the MX header is missing.

member.name: P:Rssdp.Infrastructure.SsdpDevicePublisherBase.NotificationBroadcastInterval
member.summary: Sets or returns a fixed interval at which alive notifications for services exposed by this publisher instance are broadcast.

remarks.para: If this is set to then the system will follow the process recommended by the SSDP spec and calculate a randomised interval based on the cache life times of the published services. The default and recommended value is TimeSpan.Zero.

While (zero and) any positive value are allowed, the SSDP specification says notifications should not be broadcast more often than 15 minutes. If you wish to remain compatible with the SSDP specification, do not set this property to a value greater than zero but less than 15 minutes.

member.summary: Stops listening for requests, stops sending periodic broadcasts, disposes all internal resources.

remarks.para: Defaults to a value of 1.

member.summary: Returns the full device type string.

remarks.para: The format used is urn::device::

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpDevice.Uuid
member.summary: Sets or returns the universally unique identifier for this device (without the uuid: prefix). Required.

remarks.para: Must be the same over time for a specific device instance (i.e. must survive reboots).

For UPnP 1.0 this can be any unique string. For UPnP 1.1 this should be a 128 bit number formatted in a specific way, preferably generated using the time and MAC based algorithm. See section 1.1.4 of http://upnp.org/specs/arch/UPnP-arch-DeviceArchitecture-v1.1.pdf for details.
Technically this library implements UPnP 1.0, so any value is allowed, but we advise using UPnP 1.1 compatible values for good behaviour and forward compatibility with future versions.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpDevice.Udn
member.summary: Returns (or sets*) a unique device name for this device. Optional, not recommended to be explicitly set.

remarks.para: * In general you should not explicitly set this property. If it is not set (or set to null/empty string) the property will return a UDN value that is correct as per the UPnP specification, based on the other device properties.
The setter is provided to allow for devices that do not correctly follow the specification (when we discover them), rather than to intentionally deviate from the specification.
If a value is explicitly set, it is used verbatim, and so any prefix (such as uuid:) must be provided in the value.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpRootDevice.CacheLifetime
member.summary: Specifies how long clients can cache this device's details for. Optional but defaults to which means no-caching. Recommended value is half an hour.

remarks.para: Specifiy to indicate no caching allowed.
Also used to specify how often to rebroadcast alive notifications.
The UPnP/SSDP specifications indicate this should not be less than 1800 seconds (half an hour), but this is not enforced by this library.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpRootDevice.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL used to retrieve the description document for this device/tree. Required.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpRootDevice.UrlBase
member.summary: The base URL to use for all relative url's provided in other propertise (and those of child devices). Optional.

remarks.para: Defines the base URL. Used to construct fully-qualified URLs. All relative URLs that appear elsewhere in the description are combined with this base URL. If URLBase is empty or not given, the base URL is the URL from which the device description was retrieved (which is the preferred implementation; use of URLBase is no longer recommended). Specified by UPnP vendor. Single URL.

member.summary: Sets or returns the namespace for the of this service. Optional but defaults to the UPnP schema so should be changed if is not an official UPnP service type.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.ServiceVersion
member.summary: Sets or returns the version of the service type. Optional, defaults to 1.

remarks.para: Defaults to a value of 1.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.FullServiceType
member.summary: Returns the full service type string.

remarks.para: The format used is urn::service::

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.Uuid
member.summary: Sets or returns the universally unique identifier for this service (without the uuid: prefix). Required.

remarks.para: Must be the same over time for a specific service instance (i.e. must survive reboots).

For UPnP 1.0 this can be any unique string. For UPnP 1.1 this should be a 128 bit number formatted in a specific way, preferably generated using the time and MAC based algorithm. See section 1.1.4 of http://upnp.org/specs/arch/UPnP-arch-DeviceArchitecture-v1.1.pdf for details.
Technically this library implements UPnP 1.0, so any value is allowed, but we advise using UPnP 1.1 compatible values for good behaviour and forward compatibility with future versions.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.ServiceId
member.summary: Returns the full service type string.

remarks.para: The format used is urn::serviceid:

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.ScpdUrl
member.summary: REQUIRED. URL for service description. (See section 2.5, Service description below.) MUST be relative to the URL at which the device description is located in accordance with section 5 of RFC 3986. Specified by UPnP vendor. Single URL.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.ControlUrl
member.summary: REQUIRED. URL for control (see section 3, Control). MUST be relative to the URL at which the device description is located in accordance with section 5 of RFC 3986. Specified by UPnP vendor. Single URL.

member.name: P:Rssdp.SsdpService.EventSubUrl
member.summary: URL for eventing (see section 4, Eventing). MUST be relative to the URL at which the device description is located in accordance with section 5 of RFC 3986. MUST be unique within the device; any two services MUST NOT have the same URL for eventing. If the service has no evented variables, this element MUST be present but MUST be empty(i.e., .) Specified by UPnP vendor.Single URL.

member.name: T:Rssdp.ExceptionExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to and derived objects.

member.name: M:Rssdp.ExceptionExtensions.IsCritical(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true of the specified exception is one that indicates some form of memory corruption, out of memory state or other fatal exception that should *never* be handled by user code.
member.param: The exception to check.

remarks.para: Doesn't check for System.StackOverflowExceptions as if the stack really is full calling this method might check, therefore calling code must explicitly handle that exception type itself.

Specifically checks for the following exception types;
System.AccessViolationException
System.OutOfMemoryException
System.InvalidProgramException

member.returns: True if the specified exception is considered critical and should be re-thrown and not otherwise handled by user code.
